{"id":1300279024,"question_id":99,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"3Â months","timestamp":1719352399,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"15 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1300279024/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"60.3 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\nTreeNode* first = NULL;\nTreeNode* prev = NULL;\nTreeNode* middle = NULL;\nTreeNode* last = NULL;\n\npublic:\n    void inorder(TreeNode* root) {\n        if (root == NULL) {\n            return;\n        }\n        inorder(root->left);\n\n        if (prev != NULL && prev->val > root->val) {\n            if (first == NULL) {\n                first = prev;\n                middle = root;\n            } else {\n                last = root;\n            }\n        }\n\n        prev = root;\n        inorder(root->right);\n    }\n\n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n        first = middle = last = prev = NULL;\n        inorder(root);\n        \n        if (first && last) {\n            std::swap(first->val, last->val);\n        } else if (first && middle) {\n            std::swap(first->val, middle->val);\n        }\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
